head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: Worker's Killer Is Sentenced

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: Worker's Killer Is Sentenced

block.p: A Queens man was sentenced yesterday in State Supreme Court to 25 years to life in prison for fatally shooting a city worker in 2002, prosecutors said. The man, Taiquan Williams, 25, of Jamaica, was convicted last month of second-degree murder for shooting Eugene McMahon, an employee of the Department of Environmental Protection, as he sat in his department car in Flushing, said Richard A. Brown, the Queens district attorney. Mr. Brown said Mr. McMahon, 46, was supervising a repair when Mr. Williams shot him in the head and stole his wallet.

A Queens man was sentenced yesterday in State Supreme Court to 25 years to life in prison for fatally shooting a city worker in 2002, prosecutors said.
